subject: News Summary

May 23, 2007

TOP STORIESEx-Gonzales Aide Denies Role In Firings
The Justice Department's former White House liaison denied playing a major role in the U.S. attorney firings and blamed the
                        Deputy Attorney General Paul McNulty for misleading Congress about the dismissals, calling his explanation "not fully candid." More...Watch: Ex-Gonzales Aide On Firings
• House Takes Aim At Gas Price Gougers
                     					| Watch• U.N.: Iran Enriching More, Closing Doors• Bush: Bin Laden Had Iraq PlanU.S.Millionaire Couple Charged With Slavery
A millionaire couple accused of keeping two Indonesian women as slaves in their luxurious Long Island home and abusing them
                        for years have been indicted on federal slavery charges. More...
• Lost Katrina Dogs Returned To Owner• Washington Girl Wins Geography Bee• Porn Star Rats Out Cop Over Roadside Tryst• More StoriesWorldIndia Wall Collapse Kills At Least 27 
A wall collapsed at a bar in southern India after being lashed by heavy rains. A news agency reports at least 27 people were
                        killed. More...
• U.N.: Iran Enriching More, Closing Doors• U.S. Works To ID Body Found By Iraqis
                     					| Watch• Truce Holds, Refugees Flee Lebanon Camp
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsBush's Consumer Safety Nominee Bows Out
President Bush's pick to head the Consumer Product Safety Commission withdrew his nomination amid strong opposition from some
                        Senate Democrats because of his career as a manufacturers' lobbyist.
                         More...
• House Takes Aim At Gas Price Gougers

                     					| Watch• Bush: Bin Laden Had Iraq Plan• More StoriesHealthNew Treatments Battle Cellulite Bumps
Whether you're plus-size, petite, a couch potato or an athlete, most women have lumps and bumps called cellulite. Now there
                        are some treatments that can reduce the unsightly fat many women battle. More...Watch: Combating Cellulite
• Philadelphia's Maternity Ward Crunch
                     					| Watch• Period-Free Birth Control Pill Approved

                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechMaking A Raucous Noise Unto The Whales
Marine scientists hope banging on pipes may herd two wayward humpback whales back down the Sacramento River toward the Pacific
                        Oean. So far, it hasn't worked.  More...Watch: Setback In Whale Rescue
• Shark Gives Birth Without A Father • New Summer Danger For Kids: Too Much Media• California Pushes EPA On Emissions Laws• More StoriesBusinessU.S. Flights To China Will Double By 2012
Daily passenger flights between the United States and China will more than double by 2012 and air cargo companies will have
                        virtually unlimited access to China as part of a new aviation agreement. More...
• FAA Expands Flight Flexibility• How The Web Can Make You A Smart Shopper• Ex-Coke Secretary Gets 8 Years In Jail• More StoriesEntertainmentTensions Erupt On "The View"
The bubbling political and personal tension between Rosie O'Donnell and Elizabeth Hasselbeck came to a head on "The View"
                        today when the two resurrected their fight about O'Donnell's comments on the U.S. troops in Iraq and terrorists. More...
• Jessica Alba Is A Bad, Bad Girl
                     					| Watch• Jordin Or Blake?• Oprah "Stunned" By Dad's Plan For Book
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionPolarized Polls
Partisan politics have led to a sharp rise in polarized respondents over the past 20 years as people answer poll questions
                        in a way that suggests they know what's expected of them, writes CBS News director of surveys Kathy Frankovic. More...
• If Gonzales Won't Leave, Force Him Out

                     					| Watch• After-Words• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Fla. Governor Takes On Gas Prices
Gas prices have reached record highs and people are reaching their breaking points. Florida Gov. Charlie Crist has joined
                        forces with 21 other governors to ask Congress to investigate why oil companies are reaping such huge profits. More...Watch: Florida Governor On Gas Prices

Orangutan Rampage In TaiwanCBS News RAW: An escaped orangutan went on a rampage at a public park in Kaohsiung, Taiwan. The 10-year-old ape was
                                    pursued for two hours, before being tranquilized by agricultural officials.
